DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Parted with; no longer held or possessed; incapable of being recovered or regained._The ratio of the quantity and quality of units produced to the labor per unit of time._The state of being engaged in an activity or service for wages or salary; the occupation for which you are paid._A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occupations involved in refining of raw materials, creation of finished goods, and distribution of materials or services.

Concepts.definition: Occupations involved in refining of raw materials, creation of finished goods, and distribution of materials or services.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The main category of employment for an individual.

Concepts.definition: The main category of employment for an individual.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occupations that include tradesmen, laborers, or professional employed in the physical construction of the built environment and its infrastructure, as well as professional or vocational positions of employment that involve transportation or material moving.

Concepts.definition: Occupations that include tradesmen, laborers, or professional employed in the physical construction of the built environment and its infrastructure, as well as professional or vocational positions of employment that involve transportation or material moving.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Comprises the scientific study of the human aspects of the world. They are also known as social studies. Psychology studies the human mind, sociology examines human society, political science studies the governing of groups and economics concerns itself with the allocation of wealth in society.

Concepts.definition: Comprises the scientific study of the human aspects of the world. They are also known as social studies. Psychology studies the human mind, sociology examines human society, political science studies the governing of groups and economics concerns itself with the allocation of wealth in society.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The political organization by which a state or nation is ruled.: Work, or a product of that work, done by one person or group that benefits another.

Concepts.definition: The political organization by which a nation, stateor region is ruled.
Work, or a product of that work, done by one person or group that benefits another.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A grouping of sciences including those concerned with the description, prediction, and understanding of natural phenomena, based on empirical evidence from observation and experimentation, as well as those focused on the use of scientific processes and knowledge as the means to achieve a particular practical or useful result.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of sciences including those concerned with the description, prediction, and understanding of natural phenomena, based on empirical evidence from observation and experimentation, as well as those focused on the use of scientific processes and knowledge as the means to achieve a particular practical or useful result.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any activity that is intended for refreshment or diversion.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: An active diversion requiring physical exertion and competition.

Concepts.definition: Any activity that is intended for refreshment or diversion.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
An active diversion requiring physical exertion and competition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Workers who are responsible for the visual style of: consumer and industrial products, movie and television productions, product images in magazines and newspapers, interior design, and visual effects.: A pattern of learned beliefs, values, and behavior that are shared within a group. It includes language, styles of communication, practices, customs, and views on roles and relationships.

Concepts.definition: Workers who are responsible for the visual style of: consumer and industrial products, movie and television productions, product images in magazines and newspapers, interior design, and visual effects.
A pattern of learned beliefs, values, and behavior that are shared within a group. It includes language, styles of communication, practices, customs, and views on roles and relationships.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A personal or institutionalized system grounded in belief and reverence for a supernatural power or powers regarded as creator and governor of the universe. (from dictionary.com)

Concepts.definition: A personal or institutionalized system grounded in belief and reverence for a supernatural power or powers regarded as creator and governor of the universe. (from dictionary.com)
